meanings.sent1: She is very antifur and refuses to wear any clothing made from animal fur.
meanings.sent2: The antifur campaign gained support from many animal lovers.
meanings.sent3: The antifur activist joked that she would rather freeze than wear a fur coat.
meanings.sent4: Her antifur stance was as strong as a steel wall, unwavering and resolute.
meanings.sent5: The bright red sign with 'Antifur' in bold letters caught everyone's attention at the protest.

meanings.definition: A person or group who opposes the use of fur in clothing.
meanings.sent1: The antifur organized a peaceful protest outside the fur store.
meanings.sent2: Many celebrities have joined the antifur movement to raise awareness.
meanings.sent3: The antifur group handed out leaflets with cute animals wearing 'No Fur' t-shirts.
meanings.sent4: She stood out in the crowd like an antifur beacon, spreading her message of compassion.
meanings.sent5: The antifur supporters chanted slogans against fur trade, their voices echoing through the streets.

meanings.definition: A substance or treatment used to prevent the growth of fur on animals.
meanings.sent1: The antifur spray was applied to the rabbits to keep their fur short.
meanings.sent2: The antifur treatment was effective in reducing the fur growth on the cats.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that he wished there was an antifur potion for shedding season.
meanings.sent4: The antifur solution worked like magic, leaving the animals with smooth skin.
meanings.sent5: The antifur powder created a barrier that stopped fur from growing, much to the surprise of the researchers.
